channel.title: Jarring help
channel.description:
I've followed all of the instructions on jarring a client, after I created the batch file with the jar, I ran the batch file and this is what came up.
[code]THIS BATCH IS FOR DEBUGGING THE EXECUTABLE JAR ONLY DOUBLE-CLICK THE "client.jar" TO RUN IT - Generated by: JAR Maker (http://www.goldenstudios.or.id/)
C:\Users\Ronald\Desktop>java -jar client.jar Client: Loading... Usage: node-id, port-offset, [lowmem/highmem], [free/members], storeid Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Does anyone know what may be going wrong?
Yes I set the manifest to client.

item.title: Jarring help
item.dc:creator: @I_r_Pwn_u I r Pwn u
item.description:
@I_r_Pwn_u wrote:

reyes2303:

No you just want, when setting input directory, to go into the folder that client.class is in I think. That is what worked for me. I also couldn’t get it to work for a while.

Mhm, that’s what I’ve been doing. After creating the Jar, it doesn’t run.

Read full topic

item.title: Jarring help
item.dc:creator: @reyes2303 reyes2303
item.description:
@reyes2303 wrote:

No you just want, when setting input directory, to go into the folder that client.class is in I think. That is what worked for me. I also couldn’t get it to work for a while.

item.title: Jarring help
item.dc:creator: @I_r_Pwn_u I r Pwn u
item.description:
@I_r_Pwn_u wrote:

reyes2303:

Do you have two seperate files in your client folder. One for Java and one for class?

Nope, when I first downloaded the client both file types were in the same folder. Am I supposed to have them separate?

Read full topic

item.title: Jarring help
item.dc:creator: @I_r_Pwn_u I r Pwn u
item.description:
@I_r_Pwn_u wrote:

reyes2303:

Try opening the .jar file that you have made. It should open.

I tried that already, it doesn’t open or say anything.

Read full topic
